DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity which captures the length of time it takes for chemical preservation of a biospecimen's structural and/or molecular features.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.:The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
